content: make it you can begin sizing by measuring your cat s neck circumference but other measurements that are helpful are width across chest from leg to leg circumference around ribs behind front legs length from neck to where you want the sweater to fall on the back length from behind front legs to where you want it to fall under the belly for further information on measuring your cat and sizing a cat sweater see the following https //bit ly/sizingasweater in addition to adjusting stitch numbers the exact finished size of your sweater will also depend on the yarn and hook size you choose bulkier yarn with a larger hook will result in a bigger and thicker sweater lighter weight yarn and a smaller hook will result in a smaller and lighter sweater 4 detailed instructions skip to page 11 for the abridged instructions neckband 6 00 make a slip knot onto your hook chain 13 note chain 13 or make a chain of any length that corresponds to the width you want your neckband to be consider your preferences for fit and your cat s proportions as well as your yarn weight and hook size row 1 6 30 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet x 1 in each chain to end of row row 2 onwards 7 35 chain 1 does not count as a st and turn single_crochet x 1 in 1st st single_crochet blo x 1 in each st to 2nd to last st single_crochet x 1 in last st repeat row 2 to the length required for your neckband according to your cat s size and the fit you want around the neck a rough guide to the length you will require for your neckband is to measure your cat s neck circumference and add approximately 5cm 2 to this measurement however each cat is different so please use this measurement as a guide only take into consideration how comfortable your cat is with having things slipped over their head if necessary allow extra room for your cat to be more comfortable form your neckband into a loop 10 35 once you have reached the length you need for your neckband chain 1 sl st in corresponding stitches to join short ends and form your neckband into a loop 5 body of sweater edge of neckband 11 40 chain 1 place evenly spaced single_crochet around edge of neckband sl st to 1st st to join option to disguise seam see below note i recommend placing one single_crochet at the top of each row on your neckband however your stitch count is not important and if you feel you need extra stitches please add them disguising your seam with a backwards sl st 12 45 ▪ remove hook from loop ▪ insert hook through 1st st from behind ▪ return loop to hook at the front ▪ pull yarn through
